meanings.definition: A line connecting points on a map that have the same angle of declination.
meanings.sent1: The isogon on the map showed where the angles were the same.
meanings.sent2: We followed the isogon to find areas with matching angles on the map.
meanings.sent3: The isogon on the map made it easy to navigate without getting lost.
meanings.sent4: The isogon acted like a guide, leading us to places with similar angles.
meanings.sent5: The isogon was like a secret code revealing hidden patterns on the map.

meanings.sent1: The isogon was a unique polygon with all angles equal.
meanings.sent2: We studied the isogon in geometry class to understand its properties.
meanings.sent3: The isogon looked like a shape from a math puzzle, challenging yet intriguing.
meanings.sent4: The isogon symbolized balance and symmetry in the world of polygons.
meanings.sent5: The isogon stood out among other shapes with its uniform angles.
